thread.title: Trump Continues Twitter Attack on John Lewis: He Should Focus on ‘Burning and Crime Infested Inner-Cities’
thread.title_full: Trump Continues Twitter Attack on John Lewis: He Should Focus on ‘Burning and Crime Infested Inner-Cities’

author: Joe DePaolo
title: Trump Continues Twitter Attack on John Lewis: He Should Focus on ‘Burning and Crime Infested Inner-Cities’
text:
Trump Continues Twitter Attack on John Lewis: He Should Focus on ‘Burning and Crime Infested Inner-Cities’ by Joe DePaolo | 8:22   
President-elect Donald Trump continued his attacks on Congressman John Lewis (D GA-5) Saturday night. 
After a pair of tweets earlier in the day, Trump returned to social media early Saturday evening to fire off more criticism at the Congressman — who, in an NBC interview, said he doesn’t consider Trump to be a “legitimate President,” and plans to boycott Friday’s Inauguration . Congressman John Lewis should finally focus on the burning and crime infested inner-cities of the U.S. I can use all the help I can get! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 15, 2017 
This was essentially the same line of criticism Trump had earlier in the day: Congressman John Lewis should spend more time on fixing and helping his district, which is in horrible shape and falling apart (not to…… 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 14, 2017 mention crime infested) rather than falsely complaining about the election results. All talk, talk, talk – no action or results. Sad! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 14, 2017 
Those tweets prompted Lewis’s supporters to Tweet bucolic images from the district using the hashtag #Defendthe5th, which run counter to Trump’s description of the area.
